main.name: Atul Kumar Awasthi
main.bio: Hello there!, I’m Atul, a Software Engineer with 2+ years of front-end development experience, now advancing towards becoming a Full-stack developer. I specialize in creating scalable web applications that deliver exceptional user experiences. Driven by curiosity and a passion for technology, I constantly upgrade my skills to stay at the cutting edge. I thrive on challenges and excel in transforming complex requirements into high-quality solutions. Let’s connect and see how my expertise can add value to your next project.

work.title: Software Engineer
work.description: Designed and implemented a comprehensive tool for algorithm developers and trading platforms. Enabled users to create, backtest, and transition strategies from paper trading to live trading, reducing strategy development time by 13x. Developed features to generate detailed summary reports with various chart types (heatmap, bar, line), resulting in a 14x increase in user engagement.

work.title: Software Engineer
work.description: Engineered a cutting-edge survey platform that gleaned insights from diverse regions. Crafted an engaging user interface using React JS, Redux, and Material-UI. Seamlessly integrated APIs for a holistic user experience. Orchestrated production deployments on AWS using Jenkins for scalability and reliability.

work.title: Software Engineer
work.description: Revolutionized parenting with a direct-to-consumer(D2C) website, aiding mothers and diagnosing baby health. Utilized RazzleJs for efficient web building, boosting SEO performance by 22%. Architected web view infrastructure for millions, ensuring a seamless, lightning-fast user experience.

projects.title: SocialFeed 2.0 (Next JS, Clerk, MongoDB, Tailwind CSS)
NetFlix Entertainment app (React JS, Redux, Tailwind CSS)
Podify music app (React JS, Redux Vite, Tailwind CSS)
E-commerce site (React JS, Next Js, Redux, NextAuth, Tailwind css)
Slack-on (React JS, Next Js, Styled Components, Firebase-db)

testimonials.text: “Winners never quit, and quitters never win.”
